sections.heading: Overview of Four Conditionals
sections.content:
Japanese has four main conditional forms, each with specific uses and restrictions. Understanding when to use each is key to natural Japanese.

と - Natural consequence, habitual ば - General condition, requirement たら - Most versatile, hypothetical なら - Context-based, advice

children.heading: Same sentence, different conditionals
children.content: と: 春になると、花が咲く "When spring comes, flowers bloom" (every year, natural) ば: 春になれば、花が咲く "If spring comes, flowers will bloom" (general statement) たら: 春になったら、花見に行こう "When spring comes, let's go flower viewing" (specific plan) なら: 春なら、桜が綺麗だよ "If it's spring, cherry blossoms are beautiful" (advice/info)

sections.heading: Detailed Comparison Table
sections.content: | Feature | と | ば | たら | なら | | -------------------- | ------------------- | ----------------- | ----------------------- | ---------- | | Main use | Natural consequence | General condition | Hypothetical/sequential | Contextual | | Commands after | ✗ No | ✓ Yes | ✓ Yes | ✓ Yes | | Volitional after | ✗ No | ✓ Yes | ✓ Yes | ✓ Yes | | Past result | ✓ Yes | ✗ No | ✓ Yes | Sometimes | | Discovery | ✓ Yes | ✗ No | ✓ Yes | ✗ No | | Formality | Neutral | Formal | Casual | Casual | | Versatility | Limited | Moderate | High | Moderate |

children.heading: When to use
children.content: ✓ Natural/automatic results ✓ Habitual actions ✓ Scientific facts ✓ Directions ✓ General truths このボタンを押すと、開く "When you press this button, it opens"

children.heading: When NOT to use
children.content: ✗ With commands/requests ✗ With volitional (~よう) ✗ Hypothetical one-time events ✗ Based on given context Wrong: 暇だと、手伝って ❌ Right: 暇なら、手伝って ✓

children.heading: When to use
children.content: ✓ General conditions ✓ Requirements ✓ Hypothetical (formal) ✓ Prerequisites ✓ Conditional abilities 勉強すれば、合格できる "If you study, you can pass"

children.heading: When NOT to use
children.content: ✗ With past tense results ✗ For discoveries ✗ Very casual conversation Wrong: 行けば、いなかった ❌ Right: 行ったら、いなかった ✓

children.heading: When to use
children.content: ✓ Hypothetical situations ✓ Sequential actions (when/after) ✓ Discoveries ✓ Specific future plans ✓ Most situations! 家に着いたら、電話して "When you get home, call me"

children.heading: When NOT to use
children.content: Honestly, たら works almost everywhere! It's the safest choice when unsure. Only slight awkwardness in: ⚠️ Very formal writing (use ば) ⚠️ Scientific facts (use と)

children.heading: When to use
children.content: ✓ Based on given information ✓ Giving advice ✓ Topic-oriented statements ✓ "If that's the case..." ✓ Responding to statements 東京なら、知ってる "If it's Tokyo, I know about it"

children.heading: When NOT to use
children.content: ✗ Hypothetical future (unclear) ✗ Natural consequences ✗ Discoveries ✗ Scientific facts Unclear: 明日雨なら、中止 ⚠️ Clear: 明日雨だったら、中止 ✓

children.heading: Can you use commands after?
children.content: と: ❌ 春になると、花見に行こう (unnatural) ば: ✓ 時間があれば、手伝って "If you have time, help me" たら: ✓ 終わったら、教えて "When you're done, let me know" なら: ✓ 暇なら、来てね "If you're free, come over"

children.heading: Can you describe past discoveries?
children.content: と: ✓ 家に帰ると、猫が寝ていた "When I got home, the cat was sleeping" ば: ❌ 家に帰れば、猫が寝ていた (wrong) たら: ✓ 家に帰ったら、猫が寝ていた "When I got home, the cat was sleeping" なら: ❌ 家に帰るなら、猫が寝ていた (wrong)

children.heading: Which sounds most natural?
children.content: Less natural: 明日晴れると、行く More natural: 明日晴れれば、行く Most natural: 明日晴れたら、行こう ✓✓✓ Context-based: 明日晴れなら、行けるよ For future plans → Use たら!

children.heading: Which is best?
children.content: Best: まっすぐ行くと、駅がある ✓✓✓ "When you go straight, there's a station" OK: まっすぐ行けば、駅がある OK: まっすぐ行ったら、駅がある Odd: まっすぐ行くなら、駅がある For directions → Use と!

children.heading: Which sounds natural?
children.content: Odd: 痩せたいと、運動して Wrong: 痩せたければ、運動して OK: 痩せたかったら、運動して Best: 痩せたいなら、運動したほうがいい ✓✓✓ For advice → Use なら!

children.heading: Which emphasizes condition?
children.content: Neutral: 会員になると、安くなる Best: 会員になれば、安くなる ✓✓✓ OK: 会員になったら、安くなる Topic: 会員なら、安い For requirements → Use ば!

children.heading: Which for habits?
children.content: Best: 朝起きると、コーヒーを飲む ✓✓✓ "When I wake up, I drink coffee" OK: 朝起きれば、コーヒーを飲む OK: 朝起きたら、コーヒーを飲む Odd: 朝起きるなら、コーヒーを飲む For habits → Use と!

children.heading: Many situations accept multiple forms
children.content: 時間があると、散歩する (habitual) 時間があれば、散歩します (general) 時間があったら、散歩しよう (specific plan) 時間があるなら、散歩しない？ (suggestion) All grammatically correct! Nuance differs slightly

children.heading: From casual to formal
children.content: Most casual: 暇だったら、遊ぼう (たら) Casual-neutral: 暇なら、遊ぼう (なら) 暇だと、暇だ (と) - stating fact Formal: お時間があれば、ご連絡ください (ば)

sections.heading: Decision Flowchart
sections.content: 1. Is it automatic/natural/habitual? → YES: Use と → NO: Go to 2 2. Is it a general condition/requirement? → YES: Use ば → NO: Go to 3 3. Is it based on given context/advice? → YES: Use なら → NO: Go to 4 4. When in doubt or for hypothetical → Use たら (safest choice!)

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using と with commands
children.content: Wrong: 時間があると、来て ❌ Right: 時間があったら、来て ✓ Right: 時間があれば、来て ✓ Right: 時間があるなら、来て ✓

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using ば with past
children.content: Wrong: ドアを開ければ、誰もいなかった ❌ Right: ドアを開けたら、誰もいなかった ✓ Right: ドアを開けると、誰もいなかった ✓

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using なら for hypothetical
children.content: Unclear: 明日雨なら、中止 ⚠️ Clear: 明日雨だったら、中止 ✓ Clear: 明日雨なら中止だよ (if told it will rain) ✓

children.heading: Example 1: Weather and plans
children.content: と: 雨が降ると、中止になる (always/rule) ば: 雨が降れば、中止です (general condition) たら: 雨が降ったら、中止だ (specific situation) ✓ Most common なら: 雨なら、中止だよね (based on forecast)

children.heading: Example 2: Asking for help
children.content: と: ❌ (can't use with requests) ば: 時間があれば、手伝って ✓ たら: 時間があったら、手伝って ✓ Most common なら: 時間があるなら、手伝って ✓

children.heading: Example 3: Giving directions
children.content: と: 右に曲がると、駅がある ✓ Most natural ば: 右に曲がれば、駅がある ✓ たら: 右に曲がったら、駅がある ✓ なら: 右に曲がるなら、駅がある (odd)

children.heading: たら works in most situations
children.content: ✓ Future plans ✓ Hypothetical ✓ Sequential actions ✓ Discoveries ✓ Casual conversation ✓ Commands/requests ✓ With volitional If unsure → Use たら!

children.heading: Quick reference
children.content: Natural facts: と "When you heat water, it boils" Requirements: ば "If you're a member, you get a discount" Plans/hypothetical: たら "If it's sunny tomorrow, let's go" Advice/context: なら "If you're going to Tokyo, spring is good"

sections.heading: Summary: Key Differences
sections.content: **と** ✓ Natural, automatic, habitual ✗ No commands, no volitional Example: 春になると咲く **ば** ✓ General condition, requirement ✗ No past results Example: 頑張れば成功する **たら** ✓ Most versatile! Everything works ✗ (Almost no restrictions) Example: 終わったら教えて **なら** ✓ Context-based, advice ✗ Not for natural facts Example: 東京なら知ってる

sections.heading: Practice: Choose the Best
sections.content: 1. "When spring comes, flowers bloom" Best: と ✓ 2. "If you study, you can pass" Best: ば ✓ 3. "If it rains tomorrow, it's cancelled" Best: たら ✓ 4. "If you're going to Japan, spring is good" Best: なら ✓ 5. "When you get home, call me" Best: たら ✓ 6. "When you press this, it opens" Best: と ✓
